com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier.stateid

Class StateId

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier.stateid.AbstractStateIds
      • com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier.stateid.StateId
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DocumentIdentifiers, IndexingIdentifiers, QueryIdentifiers, StateIds, Iterable<StateId>

    public class StateId
extends AbstractStateIds
    A representation of a stored state id. A state id is string token that identifies a collection of documents that matched a query.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier.DocumentIdentifiers

        DONT_MATCH_ID, DONT_MATCH_REFERENCE, ID, REFERENCE, STATE_DONT_MATCH_ID, STATE_ID

      • Fields inherited from interface com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier.QueryIdentifiers

        DATABASE_MATCH, MATCH_ID, MATCH_REFERENCE, STATE_MATCH_ID

      • Fields inherited from interface com.hp.autonomy.aci.content.identifier.IndexingIdentifiers

        ALL, DREALL, DREDBNAME, DREDOCID, DREDOCREF, DRESTATEID

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      StateId(String stateToken)
      Creates a new StateId instance for the specified state token.
      StateId(String stateToken, int document)
      Creates a new StateId instance for the specified state token with the zero-based range set to a specific document index within the stored state.
      StateId(String stateToken, int start, int end)
      Creates a new StateId instance for the specified state token with a zero-based range of document indices within the stored state.
      StateId(String stateToken, StateRange range)
      Creates a new StateId instance for the specified state token and range.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Convenience method for creating a StateId that has the same token as this but with a single document as its zero-based index range.

      Convenience method for creating a StateId that has the same token as this but with the specified zero-based index range.
      StateId forRange(StateRange range)
      Convenience method for creating a StateId that has the same token as this but with the specified range.
      StateRange getRange()
      Accessor for the index range.
      String getStateToken()
      Accessor for the state token.
      boolean isEmpty()
      A single state id can never be empty.
      Iterator<StateId> iterator()

      Convenience method for creating a list of StateIds suitable for paging through a stored state.
      int size()
      For a single state id the size is always 1.
      String toString()
      The string representation of this identifier, suitable for use as the value of a 'match' parameter on a query action.
      StateId withoutRange()
      Convenience method for creating a StateId that has the same token as this but without a range.

      • withoutRange

        public StateId withoutRange()
        Convenience method for creating a StateId that has the same token as this but without a range. If this doesn't have a range then it will just be returned.
        Returns:
        A rangeless StateId

      • forDocument

        public StateId forDocument(int document)
        Convenience method for creating a StateId that has the same token as this but with a single document as its zero-based index range. If this already has the correct range it will just be returned.
        Parameters:
        document - The document index
        Returns:
        A StateId with the specified range

      • forRange

        public StateId forRange(int start,
                        int end)
        Convenience method for creating a StateId that has the same token as this but with the specified zero-based index range. If this already has the correct range it will just be returned.
        Parameters:
        start - The start index of the range
        end - The end index of the range
        Returns:
        A StateId with the specified range

      • forRange

        public StateId forRange(StateRange range)
        Convenience method for creating a StateId that has the same token as this but with the specified range. If this already has the correct range it will just be returned.
        Parameters:
        range - The index range
        Returns:
        A StateId with the specified range

      • pages

        public List<StateId> pages(int pageSize,
                           int totalResults)
        Convenience method for creating a list of StateIds suitable for paging through a stored state. Each StateId will have the same state token as this but with different index ranges. For example, with a page size of 200 and a total results of 420, the list will contain 3 entries with ranges of [0-199], [200-399] and [400-419].
        Parameters:
        pageSize - The size of each page
        totalResults - The total number of results to generate pages for
        Returns:
        StateIds that can be used to page through a stored state

      • size

        public int size()
        For a single state id the size is always 1.
        Specified by:
        size in interface StateIds
        Overrides:
        size in class AbstractStateIds
        Returns:
        1

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        A single state id can never be empty.
